intro: Distylium sinaloense, commonly known as the Sinaloan distylium, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
